014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Field;
017import java.sql.ResultSet;
018import java.sql.SQLException;
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Comparator;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.Optional;
024import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
025
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapper;
027import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.Nested;
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.PropagateNull;
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapper;
030import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapperFactory;
031import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.SingleColumnMapper;
032import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.internal.PojoMapper;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
034import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.Qualifiers;
035import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
036
037import static java.lang.String.format;
038
039import static org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.ReflectionMapperUtil.anyColumnsStartWithPrefix;
040import static org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.ReflectionMapperUtil.findColumnIndex;
041import static org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.ReflectionMapperUtil.getColumnNames;
042
043/**
044 * A row mapper which maps the columns in a statement into an object, using reflection
045 * to set fields on the object. All declared fields of the class and its superclasses
046 * may be set. Nested properties are supported via the {@link Nested} annotation.
047 *
048 * The mapped class must have a default constructor.
049 */
050public class FieldMapper<T> implements RowMapper<T> {
051    private static final String DEFAULT_PREFIX = "";
052
053    /**
054     * Returns a mapper factory that maps to the given bean class
055     *
056     * @param type the mapped class
057     * @return a mapper factory that maps to the given bean class
058     */
059    public static RowMapperFactory factory(Class<?> type) {
060        return RowMapperFactory.of(type, FieldMapper.of(type));
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Returns a mapper factory that maps to the given bean class
065     *
066     * @param type the mapped class
067     * @param prefix the column name prefix for each mapped field
068     * @return a mapper factory that maps to the given bean class
069     */
070    public static RowMapperFactory factory(Class<?> type, String prefix) {
071        return RowMapperFactory.of(type, FieldMapper.of(type, prefix));
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Returns a mapper for the given bean class
076     *
077     * @param <T> the type to map
078     * @param type the mapped class
079     * @return a mapper for the given bean class
080     */
081    public static <T> RowMapper<T> of(Class<T> type) {
082        return FieldMapper.of(type, DEFAULT_PREFIX);
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Returns a mapper for the given bean class
087     *
088     * @param <T> the type to map
089     * @param type the mapped class
090     * @param prefix the column name prefix for each mapped field
091     * @return a mapper for the given bean class
092     */
093    public static <T> RowMapper<T> of(Class<T> type, String prefix) {
094        return new FieldMapper<>(type, prefix);
095    }
096
097    private final Class<T> type;
098    private final String prefix;
099    private final Map<Field, FieldMapper<?>> nestedMappers = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
100
101    private FieldMapper(Class<T> type, String prefix) {
102        this.type = type;
103        this.prefix = prefix.toLowerCase();
104    }
105
106    @Override
107    public T map(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
108        return specialize(rs, ctx).map(rs, ctx);
109    }
110
111    @Override
112    public RowMapper<T> specialize(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
113        final List<String> columnNames = getColumnNames(rs);
114        final List<ColumnNameMatcher> columnNameMatchers =
115                ctx.getConfig(ReflectionMappers.class).getColumnNameMatchers();
116        final List<String> unmatchedColumns = new ArrayList<>(columnNames);
117
118        RowMapper<T> mapper = specialize0(ctx, columnNames, columnNameMatchers, unmatchedColumns)
119            .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException(format("Mapping fields for type %s didn't find any matching columns in result set", type)));
120
121        if (ctx.getConfig(ReflectionMappers.class).isStrictMatching()
122            && anyColumnsStartWithPrefix(unmatchedColumns, prefix, columnNameMatchers)) {
123            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
124                format("Mapping type %s could not match fields for columns: %s", type.getSimpleName(), unmatchedColumns));
125        }
126
127        return mapper;
128    }
129
130    private Optional<RowMapper<T>> specialize0(StatementContext ctx,
131                                               List<String> columnNames,
132                                               List<ColumnNameMatcher> columnNameMatchers,
133                                               List<String> unmatchedColumns) {
134        final List<FieldData> fields = new ArrayList<>();
135
136        for (Class<?> aType = type; aType != null; aType = aType.getSuperclass()) {
137            for (Field field : aType.getDeclaredFields()) {
138                Nested anno = field.getAnnotation(Nested.class);
139                if (anno == null) {
140                    String paramName = prefix + paramName(field);
141
142                    findColumnIndex(paramName, columnNames, columnNameMatchers, () -> debugName(field))
143                        .ifPresent(index -> {
144                            QualifiedType<?> fieldType = QualifiedType.of(field.getGenericType())
145                                .withAnnotations(ctx.getConfig(Qualifiers.class).findFor(field));
146                            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
147                            ColumnMapper<?> mapper = ctx.findColumnMapperFor(fieldType)
148                                .orElse((ColumnMapper) (r, n, c) -> r.getObject(n));
149                            fields.add(new FieldData(field, new SingleColumnMapper<>(mapper, index + 1)));
150                            unmatchedColumns.remove(columnNames.get(index));
151                        });
152                } else {
153                    String nestedPrefix = prefix + anno.value().toLowerCase();
154
155                    if (anyColumnsStartWithPrefix(columnNames, nestedPrefix, columnNameMatchers)) {
156                        nestedMappers
157                            .computeIfAbsent(field, f -> new FieldMapper<>(field.getType(), nestedPrefix))
158                            .specialize0(ctx, columnNames, columnNameMatchers, unmatchedColumns)
159                            .ifPresent(mapper ->
160                                fields.add(new FieldData(field, mapper)));
161                    }
162                }
163            }
164        }
165
166        if (fields.isEmpty() && !columnNames.isEmpty()) {
167            return Optional.empty();
168        }
169
170        fields.sort(Comparator.comparing(f -> f.propagateNull ? 1 : 0));
171
172        final Optional<String> nullMarkerColumn =
173                Optional.ofNullable(type.getAnnotation(PropagateNull.class))
174                    .map(PropagateNull::value);
175        return Optional.of((r, c) -> {
176            if (PojoMapper.propagateNull(r, nullMarkerColumn)) {
177                return null;
178            }
179            T obj = construct();
180
181            for (FieldData f : fields) {
182                Object value = f.mapper.map(r, ctx);
183                if (f.propagateNull && (value == null || (f.isPrimitive && r.wasNull()))) {
184                    return null;
185                }
186                writeField(obj, f.field, value);
187            }
188
189            return obj;
190        });
191    }
192
193    private static String paramName(Field field) {
194        return Optional.ofNullable(field.getAnnotation(ColumnName.class))
195                .map(ColumnName::value)
196                .orElseGet(field::getName);
197    }
198
199    private String debugName(Field field) {
200        return format("%s.%s", type.getSimpleName(), field.getName());
201    }
202
203    private T construct() {
204        try {
205            return type.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
206        } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
207            throw new IllegalArgumentException(format("A type, %s, was mapped which was not instantiable", type.getName()), e);
208        }
209    }
210
211    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidAccessibilityAlteration")
212    private void writeField(T obj, Field field, Object value) {
213        try {
214            field.setAccessible(true);
215            field.set(obj, value);
216        } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
217            throw new IllegalArgumentException(format("Unable to access property, %s", field.getName()), e);
218        }
219    }
220
221    private static class FieldData {
222        FieldData(Field field, RowMapper<?> mapper) {
223            this.field = field;
224            this.mapper = mapper;
225            propagateNull = field.getAnnotation(PropagateNull.class) != null;
226            isPrimitive = field.getType().isPrimitive();
227        }
228        final Field field;
229        final RowMapper<?> mapper;
230        final boolean propagateNull;
231        final boolean isPrimitive;
232    }
233}
234
